DataElement.preferredName: Patient Peripheral Sensory Neuropathy Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine clinical trial participation as to whether the patient is experiencing peripheral sensory neuropathy, a nerve disorder that affects the patient's sensory nerves as outlined the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area._Having to do with the senses._A disorder affecting the cranial nerves or the peripheral nervous system. It is manifested with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness. It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.:Having to do with the senses.:A disorder affecting the cranial nerves or the peripheral nervous system. It is manifested with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness. It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs.

Concepts.definition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.
Having to do with the senses.

A disorder affecting the cranial nerves or the peripheral nervous system. It manifests with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness. It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have significant
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have significant peripheral neuropathy or sensorineural hearing loss (greater than or equal to Grade 2 by CTCAE)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have sensory/motor neuropathy greater than or equal to grade 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a prior history of peripheral neuropathy, has it recovered to grade 1 or less?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has neuropathy is Grade less than or equal to 1 by CTCAE?
